item.title: Official Android Docs (That I've Written)
item.description:
A collection of official Android documentation that I wrote while employed at Google, with editorial tweaks from the amazing tech writers I worked with!

Includes build and project structure overviews and details on dependency resolution and maintenance.

Read on for the links! Good stuff!

item.title: My Android class content for Johns Hopkins University
item.description:
I've been teaching an Android class for Johns Hopkins University since 2012. It's gone through many iterations over time, from development environments to languages to UI frameworks.

Most days I wish I just taught math. Math doesn't change like this every year.

Read on for the current and legacy content links.

item.title: My Domain-Specific Languages (DSL) class content for Johns Hopkins University
item.description:
I taught a single-term Domain-Specific Languages class for Johns Hopkins University in 2018.

Read on for the video playlist link!

item.title: My Kotlin class content
item.description:
I've been teaching a live Kotlin class for Johns Hopkins University since 2020.

Read on for the latest video playlist link!

item.title: Finding a deadlock in Android Studio
item.description: Android Studio makes it crazy easy to locate deadlocks! I'll explain how in this video.

item.title: From Java to Kotlin - Episode 1 - You've Gotta Start Somewhere...
item.description: Let's learn Kotlin from a Java point of view. We'll start by looking at some basics of Variables, Values, Classes, Properties and Constructors.

item.title: Domain-Specific Languages (DSLs) and Code Generation
item.description:
A Tech Talk I gave for Johns Hopkins University June 28, 2017.

What is a Domain-Specific Language? How can we use one for code-generation?

item.title: Design Patterns Brown-Bag Lectures
item.description: Talks on Gang-of-Four Design Patterns: Mediator, Observer, Javabeans, Model-View-Controller, Command, Template Method, Strategy and Null Object, Composite and Visitor, Factory Method, Abstract Factory and Builder

item.title: Android Intents and Fragments
item.description: A tech talk I gave for Johns Hopkins University on Oct 6, 2014 on Android Intents and Fragments.

item.title: Java 8 - Lambdas and Streams
item.description: A Java Users Group talk from September 2014 I presented on new features in Java 8: Lambdas and Streams.

item.title: Code Generation with xText and xTend
item.description:
A Java Users Group talk from July 2013 I presented on new features in JCode Generation with xText and xTend.

We'll use xText to create a custom language by specifying a grammar, read the content into a model, and generate code using xTend!

item.title: Java Enumerations
item.description:
A Java Users Group talk I presented on enumerations in Java.

I cover:

  • The old "type-safe enumeration pattern"
  • Using enums for values
  • Adding data and methods to enums
  • Using enums for the Gang-of-Four State Pattern
  • Using enums to emulate function pointers in Java
  • EnumSet and EnumMap

item.title: Template Method and Strategy
item.description: I presented a talk on the Template Method and Strategy Patterns to the Columbia, Maryland Java Users Group on 10/13/2011.

item.title: Java Dynamic Proxies
item.description: I presented a talk on Dynamic Proxies to the Columbia, Maryland Java Users Group on 12/02/2010.

item.title: Effective Eclipse
item.description: A Java Users Group talk from May 2010 I presented on Eclipse tips and tricks.

item.title: Java Annotations
item.description:
I presented a talk on Java Annotations to the Columbia, Maryland Java Users Group on 1/19/2010.

This is a very deep dive into

  • Annotation Concepts
  • Creating annotation processors
  • Using annotations at compile time and runtime
  • Generating code from annotations

item.title: ANTLR 3.x Tutorial
item.description: A video tutorial on ANTLR 3.x

item.title: ANTXR
item.description: ANTXR: Easy XML Parsing, based on the ANTLR parser generator

item.title: Import on Demand is EVIL!
item.description: There should never exist any language feature such that adding a new type to a referenced package can break your existing code. Import-on-demand (aka "start imports") is one such feature... And it's evil...

item.title: Java is Pass-by-Value, Dammit!
item.description:
I'm really tired of hearing folks incorrectly state "primitives are passed by value, objects are passed by reference".

So I'm gonna rant, and you're gonna listen...

item.title: Layering Applications
item.description: Maintainable applications can be quite tricky to develop. One of the keys to creating such a beast, is to properly layer your application.

item.title: An ANTLR 2.0 Tutorial
item.description: A tutorial on ANTLR 2.x

item.title: Converting a Grammar from LALR to LL
item.description: Converting from LALR to LL can be challenging... Hopefully this article will make it a weeeeee bit simpler...

item.title: Creating JavaBean Property Editors
item.description: Property editors are a way to make your bean more user-friendly.  Bean builder tools can determine quite a lot about your bean just by looking at it and its corresponding BeanInfo class, but they usually have only very simple methods of editing the properties in the bean.

item.title: Importifier
item.description: Automatic Expansion of Java Import Statements

item.title: JavaOne 2000/2001/2002
item.description: Some talks I gave at JavaOne in 2000, 2001, and 2002.

item.title: Swing Border Editor
item.description: Simple Swing Border Editing in GUI Builders

item.title: The JavaBean Component Model
item.description: The basics of the JavaBean Component Model

item.title: Using JavaBean Accessors
item.description: Accessors are a key ingredient to proper encapsulation.  The can restrict access to only read/write data, inform other objects of changes to data, and perform validation on new values being set.  Consistent accessor usage makes class modification easy and transparent.

item.title: Using the Right Comment in Java
item.description: Java provides three types of comments; when should we use which?

item.description: A VisualAge for Java plugin to create interfaces from classes

item.description: A Layout Manager for Split Windows

item.description: JavaBeans for BoxLayout Visualization

item.description: Visual Debugging for ANTLR 2.x
